items.title: Manchester City close in on Gu√©hi, Malen joins Roma, derby looms for Carrick: football ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ The latest football news going into the weekend ‚öΩ Premier League preview | Follow on Bluesky | Mail us A very poor 9/15 from me. Afcon is moving to a four-year cycle, a decision the Confederation of African Football has been accused of forcing through without proper consultation. Ed Aarons and Romain Molina report: Several presidents of African football federations have told the Guardian they were not informed of the decision until it was surprisingly announced by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, on 20 December, prompting claims that the confederation breached its statutes by failing to seek approval at a general assembly. Continue reading...

items.title: The tactics Carrick will hope can fix Man Utd
items.summary: BBC Sport looks at the principles, tactics and players Michael Carrick and his staff could use at Manchester United.

items.title: Slot, Salah 'talking' about Liverpool return date
items.summary: Arne Slot has said he is happy to have Mohamed Salah returning from the Africa Cup of Nations, insisting he continues to be "so important" for Liverpool.

items.title: KNVB vindt nieuwe data voor NEC - Utrecht en afgelaste KKD-duels
items.summary: De KNVB heeft nieuwe speeldata aangewezen voor de afgelaste wedstrijden in de Eredivisie en Keuken Kampioen Divisie van afgelopen weekend. NEC - FC Utrecht zal op woensdag 11 februari ingehaald worden.

items.title: 'Manchester City wil doorpakken met Guehi, Chelsea overweegt Senesi'

items.title: Sutton's predictions v WWE superstar Drew McIntyre
items.summary: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on WWE superstar Drew McIntyre - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

items.title: Toekomstvragen prikkelen Bosz: 'Je gaat geen antwoord krijgen'
items.summary: Peter Bosz werd vrijdagmiddag op de persconferentie in aanloop naar het uitduel met Fortuna Sittard andermaal geconfronteerd met vragen over zijn toekomst. De trainer van PSV beschikt over een aflopend contract in Eindhoven.

items.title: Drie op een rij voor PSV: Veerman is VI's Speler van de Maand
items.summary: De Speler van de Maand-trofee van Voetbal International is vrijdag voor de derde keer op rij in Eindhoven uitgereikt. Na Ismael Saibari (oktober) en Guus Til (november) was Joey Veerman over de maand december de beste speler in de Eredivisie volgens de beoordelingen van VI.

items.title: Van Marokko naar Newcastle: PSV werkt aan snelle terugkeer Salah-Eddine
items.summary: Peter Bosz hoopt van harte dat Anass Salah-Eddine en Ismael Saibari aanstaande zondag met Marokko de Afrika Cup winnen. Daarna keert het duo terug naar PSV. Salah-Eddine is mogelijk zelfs al op tijd voor het Champions League-duel met Newcastle United van aanstaande woensdag.

items.title: Liverpool consider drafting Mo Salah straight back into squad for Marseille trip
items.summary: Forward due to fly back from Afcon on Sunday Liverpool play Champions League game on Wednesday Liverpool are in talks with Mohamed Salah over the forward making an immediate return to Arne Slot‚Äôs squad for their Champions League trip to Marseille next week. Salah is due back at Liverpool after Egypt‚Äôs involvement in the Africa Cup of Nations ends on Saturday. Egypt face Nigeria in a third-place play-off in Casablanca after suffering another loss to a Sadio Man√©-inspired Senegal in the semi-finals. The 33-year-old Salah travelled to Morocco with uncertainty surrounding his future having accused the club of throwing him ‚Äúunder the bus‚Äù after a poor run of results and claiming he no longer had a relationship with Slot. Liverpool are unbeaten in the 11 matches since Slot first dropped Salah at West Ham. Continue reading...

items.title: McIlroy loses lead in Dubai after error-strewn second day
items.summary: Rory McIlroy found water four times during an error-strewn second round at the Dubai Invitational as the world No 2 lost his lead with a three-over 74.

items.summary: Wangerheim joins from Hammarby on contract to 2029 WSL2 Birmingham land fellow Swede Leidhammar Manchester United have signed the Sweden forward Ellen Wangerheim from Hammarby on a contract until June 2029. The 21-year-old becomes the Women‚Äôs Super League side‚Äôs third signing of the January transfer window, after Hanna Lundkvist and Lea Sch√ºller. Matt Johnson, United‚Äôs director of women‚Äôs football, told the club‚Äôs media channels that Wangerheim was ‚Äúone of Europe‚Äôs best young talents‚Äù, saying: ‚ÄúAs a dynamic, invasive and versatile forward Ellen brings variation and a natural scoring instinct to the team. Everyone at the club is excited to have her at Manchester United and the opportunity to help maximise her potential.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: 'If I had 15 attackers I'd be happy to have Salah back'
items.summary: Mohamed Salah returns to Liverpool next week with boss Arne Slot saying he would be pleased to have the forward back even if he had "15 attackers".
